{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3414257,"name":"","username":"Echoing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/echoing/{size}/222017_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T09:29:55.665Z","cooked":"

We bought the brand new Limelight 3G for off season this year, and was initially impressed by its CNC body without noticing its fanless design like a MacBook. While we are tuning autonomous, it got so hot that the 3D printed PLA support kind of melted. I wander whether it‚Äôs common for 3Gs to go overheated, and if so how everybody address that issue?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T09:29:55.665Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":75,"reads":555,"readers_count":554,"score":501.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61702,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6940 Former Co-Captain and Chief Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/1","custom_user_title":"6940 Former Co-Captain and Chief Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3414258,"name":"","username":"Jupiter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jupiter/{size}/180066_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T09:34:59.251Z","cooked":"

The 3g uses passive cooling somewhat similar to the new radios, I‚Äôd reccomend printing the Limelight mounts out of a more heat resistant material like ABS or PC

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T09:35:34.834Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":554,"readers_count":553,"score":115.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55509,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Burnt"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/2","custom_user_title":"Burnt","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414259,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T10:22:55.983Z","cooked":"

Also, like the new radios, mount the back to metal if possible so it can be a heatsink.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T10:22:55.983Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":538,"readers_count":537,"score":207.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55509,"username":"Jupiter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jupiter/{size}/180066_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/3","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414271,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T13:18:46.141Z","cooked":"

At least the limelights have mounting holes. On the new radios it‚Äôs like ‚ÄúMount this to metal‚Ä¶ but also, your only attachment methods are VHB tape (which acts as an insulator) and Zip Ties (unsecure).‚Äù

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T13:43:01.025Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":497,"readers_count":496,"score":174.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414275,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T13:32:49.376Z","cooked":"

We ran 4 of the Limelight 3G on our bot this year and didn‚Äôt experience any sort of overheating as described. Our mounts were PLA+ if I recall correctly. (Later made of aluminum, but for rigidity, not due to overheating)

I would definitely be skeptical of PLA melting. How long was the robot running when you noticed this?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T13:41:00.992Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":471,"readers_count":470,"score":109.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/5","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414280,"name":"Emerson OHara","username":"Emerson1706","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerson1706/{size}/174702_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T13:50:31.260Z","cooked":"

but be careful because the limelight 3g electrically grounds to the case.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T13:50:31.260Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":429,"readers_count":428,"score":150.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Emerson OHara","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38557,"username":"Bmongar","name":"Brad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43759,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/6","custom_user_title":"1706 Drive Coach | 9401 Mentor | #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414283,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T13:59:34.488Z","cooked":"

How dare you besmirch the good name of Zip Ties! /s

I agree this does seem like a bit of a design flaw. I‚Äôm expecting to see third-party heatsink/mounting cases made by vendors this upcoming season or the year after that. It will become a problem eventually and I‚Äôm sure teams wouldn‚Äôt mind shelling out a little extra to ensure their radio doesn‚Äôt fly across the field.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T13:59:34.488Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":401,"readers_count":400,"score":140.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/7","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414285,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T14:04:19.464Z","cooked":"

I believe by Champs, inspectors were aware of this and were not faulting teams for it. Otherwise yeah we covered our mounts in electrical tape.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T14:04:19.464Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":375,"readers_count":374,"score":85.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":43759,"username":"Emerson1706","name":"Emerson OHara","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerson1706/{size}/174702_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/8","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414302,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T15:41:06.304Z","cooked":"
Akash_Rastogi:

and were not faulting teams for it.

What does this mean

I wouldn‚Äôt fault teams for it either (I wouldn‚Äôt blame them), but they would need to fix it so that they don‚Äôt electrical fault through their frame‚Ä¶

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T15:41:06.304Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":335,"readers_count":334,"score":107.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414304,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T15:51:49.303Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

On the new radios it‚Äôs like ‚ÄúMount this to metal‚Ä¶ but also, your only attachment methods are VHB tape (which acts as an insulator) and Zip Ties (unsecure).‚Äù

On 3061, we used a combination of thermal tape and tie wraps with the hope of getting better thermal conductance from the radio to the robot structure for the new radios at Worlds.

Something along the lines of Amazon.com (though I think we used individual strips - when we made this call, we were in a hurry and went with what we could get the fastest).

Did it make a difference? All I can say is that it didn‚Äôt cause a problem and better thermal conductivity from a surface that the vendor is already telling you to heatsink can‚Äôt really be a bad thing‚Ä¶

We didn‚Äôt count on that tape for retaining the radio - it‚Äôs for heat transfer and not mechanical mounting - so we used zip ties as ‚Äúrecommended‚Äù. As @cbale2000 inferred, mounting holes would have been a nice option for secure mounting of the new radios.

Sounds like this might be a good practice for the Limelights as well.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T15:51:49.303Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":320,"readers_count":319,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Chris Herzog","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/25Mx20mmx0-15mm-Adhesive-Performance-Thermally-Heatsink/dp/B0751GYD6N","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40142,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/10","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414305,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T15:52:11.173Z","cooked":"

Meaning failing inspection for it. My recommendation is just wrapping things in e tape (including all mounting holes).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T15:52:11.173Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":281,"readers_count":280,"score":76.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28019,"username":"s-neff","name":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/11","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414306,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T15:54:01.066Z","cooked":"
Emerson1706:

but be careful because the limelight 3g electrically grounds to the case.

Ugh - say it ain‚Äôt so (though you just said it was and I believe you) - ugh.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T15:54:01.066Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":275,"readers_count":274,"score":75.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Chris Herzog","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40142,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/12","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414316,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T16:58:13.713Z","cooked":"

‚Äúfor it‚Äù

for it existing on the robot as a case-grounded component, and therefore requiring it to be removed in order to compete? (seems unreasonable, not the first and won‚Äôt be the last case-grounded component)

Or for its mounting method resulting in grounding some frame components, and the team being kept out of match play until its taped up and the frame components are measured floating? (reasonable, I would do this as an RI)

To be clear, I‚Äôm pretty sure we‚Äôre violently agreeing, I‚Äôm just genuinely confused by the usage of ‚Äúfailing inspection‚Äù and whether you intend it as a permanent vs transitory state

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T16:59:59.024Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":260,"readers_count":259,"score":87.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":8002,"username":"Akash_Rastogi","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414323,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T17:34:53.574Z","cooked":"
s-neff:

‚Äúfailing inspection‚Äù ‚Ä¶ a permanent vs transitory state

Failing inspection is a transitory state, at least in my experience. I usually phrase it as ‚Äúhaven‚Äôt yet passed inspection‚Äù or ‚Äúhave some rework‚Äù.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T17:34:53.574Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":72.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/14","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414372,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T23:03:17.968Z","cooked":"

Passive heating and higher temperatures than you expect is not necessarily ‚Äúoverheating‚Äù. It very well could be in its design parameters, and unless it was thermal throttling with passive cooling it likely was within design parameters.

It‚Äôs just hotter than you expected. Add some thermal tape and mount it to something metal, or design a heatsinking case and you should be good to go!

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T23:05:04.950Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":42.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469653,"topic_slug":"limelight-3g-melted-pla","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-3g-melted-pla/469653/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414400,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-10T02:14:12.469Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve had enough PLA parts succumb to heat deformation (sometimes when I left in the car) that I try to print parts like electronics cases or ones that are against mild heat sources out of PETG instead.
